Keyword_Questions.Keyword: What is a keyword or term used in MAIDS that you believe would be helpful to describe the keyword?
Keyword_Questions.Definition: What is the definition of the keyword?
Keyword_Questions.Link: What is the link to online material further discussing of the keyword?

Keyword_1.Definition: A simple whole blood collection and culture system for quantifying physiological reactions and interactions of the human immune system in the clinic.

Keyword_2.Definition: The product range includes optimized antibody combinations for the identification and characterization of cells of the human immune system.

Keyword_3.Definition: The unstimulated control in the TruCulture assay

Keyword_4.Definition: Lipopolysccharide. Bacterial stimuli in the TruCulture assay.

Keyword_5.Definition: Resiquimod. Viral stimuli in the TruCulture assay.

Keyword_6.Definition: Polyinosinic:polycytidylic acid. Viral stimul in the TruCulture assay.

Keyword_7.Definition: Heat killde candida albicans. Fungal stimuli in the TruCulture assay.

Keyword_8.Definition: T-cell receptor/coreceptor stimuli in the TruCulture assay. Induces a T-cell response

Keyword_9.Definition: Interferon alpha. Cytokine protein, important for initial anti-viral response.

Keyword_10.Definition: Interfron gamma. Cytokine protein, involved in activaiton of innate immune cells and in T-cell response. Important for antiviral and antibacterial immune response.

Keyword_11.Definition: Interleukin 10. Cytokine protein with immune modulatory/ immunosuppressive effects

Keyword_12.Definition: Interleukin 12. Cytokine protein important for activation of T-cell repsonse

Keyword_13.Definition: Interleukin 17 A. Cytokine protient, an effector protein of a specific T-cell subset (Th17 T-cells), important for defence againg extracellular bacteria and fungi.

Keyword_14.Definition: Interleukin 1 beta. Cytokine protein, important for acute inflammatory response.

Keyword_15.Definition: Interleukin 6. Cytokine protein, important in acute inlfammation and acute phase reactant and mediator of fever.

Keyword_16.Definition: Interleukin 8. Cytokine protein. Important for recruitment and activation of neutrophils and other innate effector cells.

Keyword_17.Definition: Tumor necrosis factor alpha. Cytokine protein, important for acute inflammatory response.
